title: Magic Action (Cast a Spell)
excerpt: Using your action to cast a spell. Most spells have a casting time of 1 action, making this one of the most common actions for spellcasters.
markdown:
# Magic Action (Cast a Spell)

When you cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, you use your [[action]] on your turn to cast it.

## Casting Time

### 1 Action
Most spells require 1 action to cast. You cast the spell and produce its effects on your turn.

### 1 Bonus Action
Some spells have a casting time of 1 [[bonus_action]]. These spells are cast more quickly than normal spells, allowing you to act and cast on the same turn.

**Limitation**: If you cast a spell as a bonus action, you can't cast another spell during the same turn, except for a [[cantrip]] with a casting time of 1 action.

### 1 Reaction
Some spells can be cast as a [[reaction]]. These spells are cast in response to a trigger specified in the spell description.

### Longer Casting Times
Some spells require more time:
- **1 minute**: Usually cast outside of combat
- **10 minutes** or more: Often [[ritual]] spells or major magical workings

## Components

Most spells require components to cast:

### Verbal (V)
- Speaking mystical words of power
- You must be able to speak
- Requires an audible voice

### Somatic (S)
- Gestures and hand movements
- Requires a free hand
- Can't cast if hands are bound or full

### Material (M)
- Physical materials or objects
- May require a spellcasting focus or component pouch
- Costly materials are consumed or required to be held

## Spell Attack Rolls

Some spells require you to make a **spell attack roll**:
- Roll d20 + proficiency bonus + spellcasting ability modifier
- Compare to target's AC
- Critical hits apply to spell attacks

## Spell Saving Throws

Some spells require targets to make a **saving throw**:
- **Spell Save DC** = 8 + proficiency bonus + spellcasting ability modifier
- Target rolls d20 + appropriate ability modifier
- Must meet or exceed your spell save DC to succeed

## Using Spell Slots

Casting a spell typically requires expending a [[spell_slot]]:
- Cantrips don't require spell slots
- You must use a slot of the spell's level or higher
- Casting at higher levels may enhance the spell's effects

## Concentration

Some spells require [[concentration]] to maintain:
- You can only concentrate on one spell at a time
- Casting another concentration spell ends the first one
- Taking damage requires a Constitution save to maintain concentration
